Comments_List: Understanding of metrics challenges and basic construction of a metric

This class was highly applicable for me, as I'm interested in working in sustainability strategy for food companies. I learned how to think through materiality assessment, stakeholder engagement, sustainable investment strategies, true value accounting, and developing relevant metrics to test a solution to a problem. Through relevant guest speakers, I saw how practitioners in the field apply these skills in their work.
How to build and execute metrics for corporate responsibility.
This is a very practical course which teaches you about the frameworks you will use as a sustainability professional to build metrics and ways to think about sustainability metrics more broadly.

How to make metrics and indicators, starting from the stakeholder, all the way to a concrete, measurable metric. 
Lots of insight into ESG concepts, the financial side of sustainability. 
Lots of learning about corporate sustainability in general.
Practical tools in measuring sustainability challenges and working toward solutions.
Very useful knowledge on sustainability

This course was useful in providing tools and methods for measuring corporate environmental performance. It gave an insight into the concept of materiality and how this plays out in investment decisions by investors. The course also explored how companies prioritize issues that are material and the standards for reporting.
